dress.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a piece of clothing worn by a woman or girl that covers the top of her body and part or all of her legs
dress.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Sheila wore a long red dress.
dress.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: clothes for men or women of a particular type or for a particular occasion
dress.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: a gentleman in evening dress (=formal clothes worn especially at important social events)
The play was performed in modern dress (=clothes from the present time).
This restaurant has a strict dress code – no tie, no service.
dress.translation[0].note_box[0].section: Have you chosen your wedding dress yet?
She arrived in a red evening dress.
She wore a little black cocktail dress.
Ellie chose a green silk dress.
Most of the women were wearing long dresses.
I need a new party dress for Christmas.
She was wearing a strapless cream dress and matching shoes.
She was photographed wearing a figure-hugging sleeveless dress.
It was an expensive dress shop.
She’s a former royal dress designer.
dress.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to put clothes on yourself or someone else
dress.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: Can you wait a minute? I’m just getting dressed.
She dressed quickly and went out of the house.
I usually have to dress the kids in the mornings.
She dressed Louis in his best blue shirt.
dress.translation[1].definitions[0].note: In everyday English, people usually say get dressed rather than dress:
I got dressed and went downstairs for breakfast.
dress.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: to wear a particular kind of clothes
dress.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: Dress warmly if you’re going out for a walk.
We usually dress for dinner (=wear formal clothes for our evening meal).
I spend most of my time in the house with young children, so I dress casually.
How do you normally dress for work?
dress.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: to make or choose clothes for someone
dress.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: Versace dressed some of the most famous people in Hollywood.
dress.translation[1].definitions[3].defi: to clean, treat, and cover a wound
dress.translation[1].definitions[4].defi: to clean and prepare meat or fish so that it is ready to cook or eat
dress.translation[1].definitions[5].defi: to put oil, vinegar, salt etc onto a salad
dress.translation[1].definitions[6].defi: to put an attractive arrangement in a shop window
dress.translation[1].definitions[7].defi: to stand in a straight line, or to make soldiers do this
dress.translation[1].definitions[8].defi: to arrange someone’s hair into a special style
dress.translation[1].definitions[9].defi: to prepare or put a special surface onto wood, stone, leather etc
